meanings.definition: To make illegitimate or undermine the legitimacy of something.
meanings.sent1: By spreading false rumors, they were delegitimizing the election process.
meanings.sent2: The opposition party tried delegitimizing the new law by pointing out flaws.
meanings.sent3: The cat was delegitimizing the dog's authority over the backyard.
meanings.sent4: The storm's destruction was delegitimizing the once sturdy building.
meanings.sent5: The magician's tricks were delegitimizing the audience's belief in magic.

meanings.definition: To discredit or diminish the authority or validity of something.
meanings.sent1: The fake news was delegitimizing the scientist's research findings.
meanings.sent2: Her constant criticism was delegitimizing his leadership in the team.
meanings.sent3: The prankster was delegitimizing the seriousness of the meeting with his jokes.
meanings.sent4: The graffiti on the wall was delegitimizing the beauty of the neighborhood.
meanings.sent5: The loud noise was delegitimizing the peaceful atmosphere of the park.
